alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 30 at 10:49AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOW, RAIN AND WIND POSSIBLE TO START FEBRUARY... Confidence is increasing for a impactful storm systems across the region mid to late week. Moderate to heavy snowfall, followed by moderate to heavy rainfall is possible midweek, starting as early as Tuesday night. A drop in temperatures is expected through Tuesday morning across the Panhandle ahead of the storms. Confidence is increasing that Baranof Island, Prince of Wales Island, and the southern Panhandle will get accumulating snow Tuesday night into Wednesday morning before the change to rain. Lower confidence remains regarding exact snowfall amounts before a transition to rain. A second system arrives Thursday with much warmer air and potentially heavier rain across the region. Confidence in heavy rain and wind is growing for Thursday into Friday. The warmer, stormy pattern could persist into the next weekend. Please monitor for updates as confidence in the forecast grows.
